topic.title: What to do when a zite doesn't finish updating?
topic.body:
The zite in question is [08chan](/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/), it updates most of the zite but gets to about 750 files and never finishes. I tried deleting it and redownloading it and it still hangs at around 750.

What do?

topic.title: How many people are running a ZeroNet server vs. just running a client?
topic.body: I've been running my server for the last 3 weeks and have been loving this. But, I started noticing more people posting ZeroNet links with 127.0.0.1 addresses, which got me wondering how many people are running a server vs. the client only.

1614197588_1AHGnE7rAzw84wX7v3oNeZvUuyB5c.body:
> [ihaphleas](#comment_12_1PZivKEBF8sdpTRbeb9Wug8HMv3Cfvqo5A): No peers ... try to keep it up, I'd like to see

I'll keep it up for a while.

1614627631_1PZivKEBF8sdpTRbeb9Wug8HMv3Cf.body: Very simple and sleek design, I love it.

1614650318_19RaaMJeGXcJzLxeKXWH9pynfjgmm.body:
> [ihaphleas](#comment_22_1PZivKEBF8sdpTRbeb9Wug8HMv3Cfvqo5A): Try reloading the site. Sometimes ZeroNet does ask to increase the size while updating and on that particular page --- so you may just need to increase the space available. [...]

Over night the failed count went from 755 to 657, so I think I need to let it keep trying to update.

1615948566_19RaaMJeGXcJzLxeKXWH9pynfjgmm.body:
> [papull](#comment_38_1Nz5xXKiiTFGd6big5zcBnaGVH3hUUYv4G): how does one run a zeronet server?

Get a computer, install ZeroNet on it, install tor, configure ZeroNet to accept connections from other computers on your network, leave that computer running 24/7.

1616231596_1CQzPmMXnfH3eJvpKGNfsVnUXxiHZ.body: It's not dead. Engagement is low, but that means you need to contribute more.

1616224608_18V3yAk827Q61WfYormvHGbKgDx3c.body:
> [jeff](#comment_103_1JFfyAT1DysW4LbK6WRd2szDoPjWgb22NT): DeSantis Rules! He should run for President!

If he does, he would be a force to be reckoned with.

1616203894_18V3yAk827Q61WfYormvHGbKgDx3c.body: Not a bad video. It's a good watch for someone who knows a little about tech but never jumped into the inner workings.

> [kapec](#comment_90_1CQ14MAUEp55ijU6rQLQ9vZdzxCQe9s1SF): could you mirror it to zeronet or a torrent file?

[Took care of it](/big.kopykate.bit/?Video=1616267068_19RaaMJeGXcJzLxeKXWH9pynfjgmm33VZS)

1616503348_1GooUE19488nDwG3TdkM8seYAHct4.body: With the fork, will there be compatibility with the old ZeroNet? Or, would zites need to be recreated? What about the user keys, will they need to be recreated?

> [geekless10](#comment_10_12PZt1S4yo8R3U46XFTnreGTjAhThDppe4): There for sure should be the backward compatibility with the existing zites. [...]

That would be great. Maybe even fork the [Updater](/1uPDaT3uSyWAPdCv1WkMb5hBQjWSNNACf/) to make the migration seemless.

> [theredexpress](#comment_1_1LP7F1mhUwNngPMGkGPTbd3UH51QYYKm5g): One thing ZeroNet has needed for some time is a website builder/manager similar to Wordpress baked into the app. I can get by with using a third-party's software to make a zite of my own, but it would be better to have one in-house to ensure compatibility and speed up deployment/updates. Especially when all I want to do is post an original article or video.

Why not clone [ZeroBlog](/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/) and modify it to your liking?

1616492110_1N4xxyVXrKEEU32y64hhtofe4EwM6.body:
> [gungraber](#comment_3_1K8bF1myH44sV7RTyriZqX6TCtbcRmTAym): It's a totalitarian hegemonic project to establish planetary serfdom started with the league of nations and the establishment of the federal reserve system/IRS. [...]

But, what does it stand for? United Nations Oligarchy?

1616871818_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
Odysee - The creator admitted that they honor any DMCA requests that come in. But, they do not have the ability to delete the videos, only to delist them from the Odysee site. Since the LBRY backend can be accessed by anyone, nothing is stopping someone from making a site like Odysee in another country that the DMCA does not have control over, and to host those videos. Since the video's are not deleted, only delisted, anyone can circumvent the copyright and DMCA laws by creating another site in another country that accesses the LBRY blockchain.

Bitchute - Partnered with [HopeNotHate](http://www.theburkean.ie/articles/2020/12/13/bitchute-removes-extremist-content-in-partnership-with-hope-not-hate) to purge the site of "extremist" content.

Rumble - This is new to me, so I'm still researching it.

GabTV - Based off Gab.com, which had deleted a post from Andrew Anglin because they were threatened by AsianRegistry.

https://web.archive.org/web/20170905105120/https://medium.com/@getongab/we-are-at-war-for-a-free-and-open-internet-426629fba4bf

DTube - Used to be a proxy to YouTube in the same way that [Invidious](https://invidious.snopyta.org/feed/popular) is. Apparently, them going to a blockchain/IPFS based backend and hosting videos is new to me. So, I can't comment on what they are doing now.

All the other sites are new to me, too. So, I can't comment on them, either. These four are what stood out to me because I remember some of their histories and wanted to make sure that they are all sus. Odysee is, so far, the best because while the site might delist a video, it's not deleted and can still be accessed if someone else creates a site that accesses everything the LBRY backend offers (without the delistings).

1617039004_1EDgrafDZQ8H6WLq6jHin6NKfQ8qZ.body:
> [sword00000](#comment_57_18yzU6FADirNEPhLVyRHBdnfVQaATfTk3S): There is no Plan B. There is only those that Plan, and those that don't. Build, support, and use privacy respecting platforms. [...]

Exactly. This is why I bought myself a Dell r510. I have gotten more use out of that than I ever did with raspberry pi's. And slowly I'm building out infrastructure that my friends and family can use instead of big tech platforms.

1617244448_18V3yAk827Q61WfYormvHGbKgDx3c.body: It's been like that since Biden took office. Everything has been ratio'd something fierce.

> [geekless](#comment_294_1GooUE19488nDwG3TdkM8seYAHct4gjkq4): By the way... Should I implement the dislike button for ZeroTalk++?

Why even need likes/dislikes? If you want to list posts by popularity, then sort by engagement.

1617435563_1KZdUJK67R6bzE4w2tXQTvkKNfmsq.body:
> [reichama](#comment_86_19M1Unu2z3j9WyiQ1vcgG6yGnPRmTkUkVe): Not just since yesterday, mind you. The switch occurred around 2014.https://a.pomf.cat/dwfewn.png

The jannies power trip from Gamergate is what caused the exodus to 8chan. Only to find that the cultural authoritarian reach is much further than most thought.

> [coplanar](#comment_3_1KZdUJK67R6bzE4w2tXQTvkKNfmsqubWoD): I miss 8chan so much. I wish there were a decentralized version that everyone went to.

We have [Millchan](/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/) but there's very little traffic and almost entirely porn (my blacklist is large as hell).

1618347400_1HV7aMJLo3XMuij1h17kP12ZYvp1Y.body:
I run ZeroNet on my server 24/7, without any issues.

After I installed it, I set up a systemd service to manage the starting and stopping of the peer, as well as configured it to accept incoming connections from my network so I can open my browser and instead of pointing it to 127.0.0.1, I point it to the server's IP address (this is also why some people hate when someone posts a link with localhost instead of everything after the localhost).

1621607826_1By85xCDz7VyZEq9WjmhtbNaPKimQ.body: RIP Freenode. It sure was a wild ride.

1621555984_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
> [znakesonaplane](#comment_9_16AJ9b5xA1cGPoWqrCQSi1TiNR3Hp8ASiE): agreed. he's either a paid troll or else an utter moron.

It's painfully obvious that glowies are on zeronet.

1610754180_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
> [styromaniac](#comment_3098_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): Yeah, I'm not liking Elon anymore. He's even calling for a carbon tax.

Of course he's calling for a carbon tax. He's in the business of making zero emissions facilities and vehicles. A carbon tax will hurt his competitors. Him being in favor of that doesn't surprise me and isn't a concern for me because I expect that from him. But, him stopping the acceptance of bitcoin for Telsa under the idea that it will contribute more people to building server farms and increasing the carbon footprint is flat out wrong and stupid.

He could have said they would stop accepting bitcoin because of their inability to report earnings or taxes and can cause Telsa massive troubles with the government, that would have made more sense. But, to go to the environment as the reason, it's starting to make him glow a bit.

1622537604_17qgF4cL3wN9yvkUtEPnVBMvL1exu.body: They should also teach how to do basic income tax. CPA's should focus more on businesses and tax laws, but knowing how to fill in the fields on your income tax form should be simple and everyone should learn this in high school.

1623652167_1ByyvGdKSdKTywR6F8tmFAk3RsWUH.body:
> [baduser](#comment_36_1KTDVd4rtqErz3FcxPx2nTmr4CSR9Q7hcr): You should really replace your local IP with 127.0.0.1. No need to expose your internal network addresses to the world (also they don't work for anyone except yourself).

There's no need to include that when making a link. Put the / and the long string of characters and the trailing / within the parenthesis and that link will work for everyone equally.

Not everyone runs zeronet on their local machine, some run it on a dedicated server. Writing links like that prevents the wrong address trying to be reached.

1625040651_1MyrzoBgoPciJQwULUSsKn5tCbkWX.body: Does anyone have a retard to english translator?

1626704177_1JMn7zrA5b35HR8wTSeyQrbCSxj2L.body: Developers to get ZN to support the new Tor version.

1628591661_1NV3qFKgLf7Nnx7L5txkzsg13nuj3.body:
> [jackzeng6666](#comment_31_1AmXimBQuPemuoTM9NFYg9Mn5YY6HomhAm): You can't. Youtube needs to store a lot videos, if you want to connect, that needs a people download all youtube then seed it. I think nobody wants to do that.

I don't think that's what he means.

I think he's talking more like to create a zite that acts as a proxy so that you can still reach out to clearnet and browse. For example, a zite that works like invidous does; Being a proxy to youtube so much of the bullshit on youtube is removed like ads or their recommended lists.
